page.title: 17Fuels used in Homes.
page.content: The only mains fuel readily available is electricity. Locals don't find this very economic. Despite this 7 out of the 18 interviewed said that they used electricity as their main fuel supply. A majority said they would use gas, if it were on mains. The main fuel supply normally included that used for regularly heating the house and the water. Oil was used by 3 people, in most cases because it was already there when they bought their property. Most small cottages used rayburns which heated the rooms, water and for cooking. Wood was almost as popular as electricity probably because it comes in a good supply and is reasonably cheap locally. Almost half of the people interviewed used a secondary sorce of fuel i.e. log fire or calor gas heater for either economic or ornamental reasons.
